metadata.title: CVE-2016-5399 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The bzread function in ext/bz2/bz2.c in PHP before 5.5.38, 5.6.x before5.6.24, and 7.x before 7.0.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds write) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted bz2archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
